sub_topic: Finding the area of triangles using trigonometry
message_1: A right-angled triangle with base 8 cm and height 10 cm is given. Using trigonometry, find the area of the triangle. Round your answer to two decimal places.
message_2:
To find the area of a right-angled triangle, we can use the formula:

Area = (1/2) * base * height

In this case, the base is 8 cm and the height is 10 cm. So, the area of the triangle is:

Area = (1/2) * 8 * 10
Area = 4 * 10
Area = 40 square cm

The area of the triangle is 40 square centimeters.
